definition: clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: A dispatch confirmation notice was sent to the customer.
sentences.chinese: 向客戶發送派送確認通知。

sentences.english: You have stated that you will scan e-mail in order to target advertisements based on its content.
sentences.chinese: 你們說你們會掃描郵件然後根據郵件的內容派送廣告。

sentences.english: Many even make compilations of their data sheets available free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 許多製造商甚至還將相關數據編輯成冊免費派送。

sentences.english: Payment has been taken and order items have been dispatched.
sentences.chinese: 已進行了支付，訂單物品已經派送。

sentences.english: The use case ends once dispatch is confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 一旦派送確認，此用例就結束了。

sentences.english: Little Johnny is delivering newspaper one morning.
sentences.chinese: 小莊尼一天早上派送報紙。

sentences.english: Or it is meal cent door fastens a courtyard to distribute, by mess of each courtyard proper motion.
sentences.chinese: 或是將餐飲分門別院派送，由各院自行用膳。

sentences.english: The order items have recorded as dispatched.
sentences.chinese: 訂單物品已記錄爲已派送。

sentences.english: Take order payment and dispatch order items to the customer.
sentences.chinese: 獲取訂單支付款項並向客戶派送物品。

sentences.english: The caskets can be dispatched to buyers within 48 hours.
sentences.chinese: 棺木可以在買家下單後48小時內派送。

definition: to put together an order and deliver it (i.e. 配貨|配货[pei4 huo4] and 送貨|送货[song4 huo4])/to deliver (goods)
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
to put together an order of goods
